brief_summary.textblock: single anastomosis sleeve jejunal bypass with hiatal repair for morbid obesity with reflux manifestations

detailed_description.textblock: preoperative endoscopy was done and if hiatus hernia was present the patient is undergo single anastomosis sleeve jejunal bypass with hiatal repair for morbid obesity with reflux manifestations

primary_outcome.measure: the effect of sleeve jejunal bypass on reflux manifestations
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of the effect of sleeve jejunal bypass on reflux manifestations

secondary_outcome.description: excess weight loss at one year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- obese patients with BMI more than 40 with or without co-morbidity or more than 35 with co-morbidity
- patients fit for laparoscopic surgery
- give approval to share in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients refused to share in the study
- patients unfit for surgery
- patients aged less than 18 and older than 60
- patient with previous upper abdominal surgery either for obesity or other diseases
- revisional bariatric procedures
